comments.author: Sergio Torres
comments.comment: some description for this attribute

comments.author: Sergio Torres
comments.comment: This is adding in Upper case the ADDRESS to the widget title, this would be better have to attributes in the tag, one for the title of one widget, and other attribute for the title of the second widget.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment:
Agree with the Upper case title, not the best approach. Seems like I don't think too much in all scenarios. I've created the following task FAB-6497 to clarify the correct title format for paper and phone Intake.
The second point about the two titles is complicated. The tag is use in many different ways and for rendering different widget for different purposes. I don't agree with add and extra attribute. If the first point is well defined and correctly formatted it will be enough.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment:
Wrong implementation. Do you read the suggested implementation? You are calling in every step to check the condition.
Capture if the Intake is for Phone or not just once and pass that boolean value to every method.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: As I wrote twice, just capture the boolean value once and pass that value to every method.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Why? There's no need to do that in Java. This is not Pascal or C. You can create the variables only when you really need them.
